alert.note: Alert for Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western St. Lucie and east central Okeechobee Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northeast of Four Seasons Estates, or 14 miles southeast of Fort Drum. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western St. Lucie and east central Okeechobee Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter immediately inside a building or hard-topped vehicle.
